bill_title: revise fees for resident nurserymen and nursery stock dealers.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise fees for resident nurserymen. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 38-24B-7 be amended to read as follows: 38-24B-7. The Department of Agriculture may issue a certificate of inspection to any nurseryman, operating as a resident nurseryman or dealer, whose nursery stock has been officially inspected and found to be viable and free from pests. The biennial fee for the inspection and certification is as follows: (1) Resident nurseryman: three hundred fifty dollars plus ten dollars for each acre over one acre of field-grown inspected plants and ten dollars for each ten thousand square feet of container-grown plants, except the fee for a resident nurseryman with less than five thousand dollars in gross sales on nursery stock is: seventy-five dollars plus ten dollars for each acre over one of field-grown inspected plants and ten dollars for each ten thousand square feet of container-grown plants; (2) Resident nurseryman with at least five thousand but less than twenty thousand dollars in gross sales on nursery stock: one hundred seventy-five dollars plus ten dollars for each acre over one of field-grown inspected plants and ten dollars for each ten thousand square feet of container-grown plants; (3) Resident nurseryman with twenty thousand dollars or greater in gross sales on nursery stock: three hundred fifty dollars plus ten dollars for each acre over one of field-grown inspected plants and ten dollars for each ten thousand square feet of container-grown plants; (4) Nursery stock dealer with less than five thousand dollars in annual gross sales of nursery stock: one hundred twenty-five dollars; (3)(5) Nursery stock dealer with more than at least five thousand but less than twenty thousand dollars in annual gross sales of nursery stock: two hundred dollars; or (4)(6) Nursery stock dealer with more than twenty thousand dollars or greater in annual gross sales of nursery stock: three hundred fifty dollars.

bill_versions.bill_version: Senate Agriculture and Natural Resources Engrossed
bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise fees for resident nurserymen and nursery stock dealers. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 38-24B-7 be amended to read as follows: 38-24B-7. The Department of Agriculture may issue a certificate of inspection to any nurseryman, operating as a resident nurseryman or dealer, whose nursery stock has been officially inspected and found to be viable and free from pests. The biennial fee for the inspection and certification is as follows: (1) Resident nurseryman: three hundred fifty dollars plus ten dollars for each acre over one acre of field-grown inspected plants and ten dollars for each ten thousand square feet of container-grown plants, except the fee for a resident nurseryman with less than five thousand dollars in gross sales on nursery stock is: seventy-five dollars plus ten dollars for each acre over one of field-grown inspected plants and ten dollars for each ten thousand square feet of container-grown plants; (2) Resident nurseryman with at least five thousand but less than twenty thousand dollars in gross sales on nursery stock: one hundred eighty-five dollars plus ten dollars for each acre over one of field-grown inspected plants and ten dollars for each ten thousand square feet of container-grown plants; (3) Resident nurseryman with twenty thousand dollars or greater in gross sales on nursery stock: three hundred fifty dollars plus ten dollars for each acre over one of field-grown inspected plants and ten dollars for each ten thousand square feet of container-grown plants; (4) Nursery stock dealer with less than five thousand dollars in annual gross sales of nursery stock: one hundred twenty-five dollars; (3)(5) Nursery stock dealer with more than at least five thousand but less than twenty thousand dollars in annual gross sales of nursery stock: two hundred twenty-five dollars; or (4)(6) Nursery stock dealer with more than twenty thousand dollars or greater in annual gross sales of nursery stock: three hundred fifty seventy-five dollars.
